name: David Schmitt
text: I was looking at some water damage which occurred at the very bottom of each sidelite on my front door.  Replacing the entire door was going to be very expensive.  Danny came in and replaced only the damaged sidelites.  He did an excellent, quick and clean job and saved us a ton of money.  Thank you very much for your great work and professionalism!  If you need a window or door replaced or repaired, Danny is the guy to call.

text: The neighbors kids broke our front door glass accidentally playing ball. .  We called the window and door pros after hours and they came out the same evening and replaced it. They were very personable and easy to work with.  We appreciated the prompt service.

name: Matt Johns
text: I’ve used Window & Door Pros twice in the past few years and will call them whenever we need to have windows or a sash replaced. Danny goes out of his way to give his customers the very best experience. Today after replacing a window sash in my basement he helped me resolve a security system issue with the magnet contacts in several of my windows up stairs. I told him about the issue and he said he would be happy to look at it and try to resolve the problem. Great service!

resp.text: Thanks Matt! We really appreciate you!

text:
Danny and Connie were such a pleasure to work with. I can't say enough great things about this company! Thank you so much for our amazing new windows. We will definitely be spreading the word!

name: A Renee
text: I don’t normally do reviews, but the service was so good I felt like I needed to. I contacted this company because I needed to get my patio door fixed as it was completely shattered.  It was so easy. The lady who answered the phone was nice. I texted a picture of my door to them on Tuesday morning and my door was fixed the next day. Danny was polite, quick, efficient, and he cleaned up all of the glass when he was done. If I need any other glass repairs I will definitely go back to this place.

resp.text: Thank you so much! we really appreciate the positive feedback.  Glad we could help.

name: Jason Lowe
text: Incredible company to work with. Had a French Door glass replaced the same day! A couple of other companies told me it would be a few weeks before they could get a replacement.  They are very professional and friendly people. Thanks so much!! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Jason!  We really appreciate the feedback.

name: Sarah Dillon
text: I am so thankful for the Window and Door Pros!! My father's home was recently burglarized and a window was smashed to gain entry.  The Window and Door Pros were the ONLY company he contacted that were willing to replace his window for him.  No one else would even come give an estimate! I heard the owner on the phone with my dad and he was so kind and reassuring in dealing with him.  It is so good to know that there are still people out there who care and help those in difficult times and are not just concerned about profit.  Thank you so much!

resp.text: Thanks Sarah! We were glad we could help!

name: Caitlyn Clemons
text: I contacted The Window and Door Pros when my door was kicked in.  Within 24 hours I had a new door installed.  So thankful for quick friendly service!

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback! we appreciate your business. Glad we could help.

name: Ted Bell
text: Called this joke of a company on a Monday to get an estimate on a door frame repair. The woman that answered told me a "Danny" would call me back to set up an appointment. So I wait , next day nothing,  so I wait and on Friday I call back and this same lady acts like she didn't get the message to Danny somehow so she has this guy call me. Ok , big Danny calls me says he is on the way to some other address that's not even mine. Anyway I give him my address he says oh yeah I can be there between 3 and 4 pm. Never shows up, never calls , nothing. Hey window and door so called pros. If you don't want to take a job how about do the decent thing and let a customer know that from the beginning, but no these goofs from window and door pros will string you along and leave you hanging. Stay away from these people, total joke.

resp.text: I sincerely apologize for your poor experience.  Sometimes things get crazy around here and we get overwhelmed with emergencies and calls.  It is never our intention to overlook a potential customer.  Thank you for letting us know we need to improve our services.  I completely understand your frustrations. Again, I really do apologize and will strive to do better in the future.

name: eric malone
text: Good and very professional..Thanks... you have my business...

resp.text: Thanks Eric! We really appreciate your business.  Glad we could help.

name: Christopher Allison
text: I asked this company to give an estimate for repairs.  They came to my home, inspected the windows, then never called back.  Thanks to their non response, the buyers of my home then requested all windows be replaced.  The owner of Window and Door pros came back to my house two weeks later, which he vaguely recalled, and gave an estimate of $12,000 to replace the windows because he said they could not be repaired.  However, he would not put the estimate in writing, so my contract with the buyers became null and void.  After the fact, I did some research and found the replacement balances for my windows form Swisco for all of $300.00 to repair 16 windows in my home.  This company is as dishonest as they come.  The owner was more interested in talking about his cool upgrades to his Ford F150 than he was about fixing my windows.  I would never use this company for any repair unless you want to be treated poorly and taken advantage of!!!!!

resp.text: We are so happy to hear you found replacement parts for your windows because the original manufacture is no longer in business and we were unable to purchase parts from them.  We wanted to be honest and not give an estimate in writing for the future owners if we would be unable to complete the work. We felt like that would be dishonest to give an estimate that we were unable to honor in the future. We vocalized this to your father as well as sent him an email.  We  certainly apologize for any miscommunication on our part.   It's just very important to us to not give an estimate in writing if we cannot honor it.

name: Maria Turner
text: This was the worst experience that I had ever.  This company do not do good customer service at all. I order in February 2021 and my install date was April  8, 2021 a total of 9 windows with colonial grids. The installer came  with the windows  with no grids all plain windows  and we told the salesperson Robin 5 time we wanted  grids because we had windows install before like 2 years ago and we wanted these to match. For some unknown reason she fail to check the section with the grids on the paperwork.  And no, we did not let them install the plain windows because that's not what we order, but they got our down payment and said it will take  a couple of weeks to get grids and the windows install. It's July 2021 and we still have not got our windows installed  yet , I have called  and called and all I get is they been ordered and they should be here any day now. I call the install manger Dexter no responses, never. I will never ever use this company again. I thought this was a good reputable company.

name: Jennifer Campbell
text: So, we ordered windows 6 weeks ago for our house.  Our instillation day was last week.   We had called right after the sale to change the window color and spoke with the sales rep, who sold us the windows, as well as called the office to ensure the change had been made. We reinterred the change when we signed the paper for the 2nd measurement to ensure the color was corrected. When the installers showed up, one of our 4 windows was measured incorrectly and in addition the windows were not the right color. The installers remeasured (this is the 3rd measurement since sale) and stated someone would call us.  This was on a Thursday.... no call.  So we attempted to call on Monday and spoke with someone who stated they would put a note in and someone would call us back....... No Call.  So we called again on Wednesday......Same spill..... NO CALL!.... I have yet called again and was given the same speech and that they are unable to get any of the project managers on the phone, so they will send them a message to call back.  I find this to be a little ridiculous at this point.  The company has taken half of my money for the instillation and I have no idea if the windows are being remade or anything at this point.  I have no answers and I am not even sure if I can get a refund at this point because you can not get anyone on the phone typically.   I personally would advise anyone looking for windows at this point to check out a different company.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for the delay you're describing. Please reach out to us directly in national customer care, so we can work with you to get this taken care of as soon as possible – 513-327-7338. Thank you.

text: We had to hunt them down on our window installation that went from “8 weeks to install” to over DOUBLE that time frame (around 5 months!). text: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! We ordered multiple exterior doors in January. The rep measured them and then someone else came out to measure again. Now a total of 5 people have come out to measure and we’ve received 2 doors that don’t fit. This is the worst experience I’ve ever had with a “reputable” company that’s been in business for years. name: Edward Griffin
text:
EDIT:
2021 Update

TL;DR We were so pleased last time, we decided to hire Champion to replace 4 doors in our home. I'm incredibly disappointed. Our order was managed poorly - the left hand doesn't seem to know what the right hand is doing - and we're still waiting 6 months later for 3 doors to be installed. From this experience, it's hard to say whether I'd recommend Champion again. I like the product a lot, but I'm very disappointed with the progress of this project.

We were so pleased with Champion before, that we decided to hire them for 4 new doors around our house. January, they came and measured the doors and told us they would be installing the end of Feb or beginning of March (can't remember exactly). They show up and one of the doors is just right, one door is the *wrong* door, and the other two were not measured or manufactured properly. Ok, mistakes happen, I get it. So they tell me they'll order new doors and get back in a month. It's a busy time or something, right? They tell me the doors won't be ready until May. May rolls around, nothing. I start calling in June and nobody knows what I'm talking about, I have to tell the representative what my problem is and she tells me she'll have to contact the local office, gives me her number, and tells me to call her the following week. I call her the following week and she doesn't answer. I call the HQ and the rep has to take all my information again because my record isn't clear to her. I call the local office, nobody answers. I call HQ again, nobody answers. I finally get a call in JULY that *one* door is ready to be installed. "One door," I ask, "we are waiting for 3 doors." The rep is confused. All he has in his records is one door. I'm contacted by another rep the same day who says she got in contact with the local office, who weren't able to tell her whether the door had even been ordered and, again, I had to remind the rep that we had ordered 2 other doors.

resp.text: Champion appreciates the feedback in order to improve our customer service. We also appreciate all the kind words and glad to see you enjoying our windows. Champion Customer Care

text:
Previously, I left a really positive review. And said “Best deal in town! Mark, their sales rep, was professional and informative. Great deal on siding. Better than the other companies we have had come out. Answered all questions!”
Well, it turns out that after Mark got us to sign up for a certain price and we financed through their company, they told us actually is was $5000 more than the quote. After weeks of trying to understand, a third person came out to remeasure, who was very nice and said that Mark missed measured by 20 feet on each side of our house, but that he was going to have the rep “eat the difference”. A week later, we still could not get answers but the loan company wanted a payment because Champion already took $5000 from our loan. Mark then called back and said they would knock it down $600 bucks, but it still went up $4400. We now have had to file a dispute and complaint with the loan company against Champion. We have called every number we can to talk to someone and keep leaving messages with people at Champion with no response. They have our money, but have done no work. So here we are 6 weeks later, with a loan we don’t need, and Champion refusing to give us answers, only the sales rep who messed up the first time telling us there is nothing they can do.

resp.text: Thank you, Christina!

text: Donna was the best!!   She answered every question and was able to give me great value at a great price.

name: Benjamin Bylsma
text:
I don’t know what to say about this company but beware and ask for the best installers upfront!! We had 6 windows replaced. Original installers showed up over an hour late. No call but quickly made work of removing and installing new windows. Everything was going ok at this point. After install they spay foamed around exterior of window. I had to point out a couple of places where I could still see daylight coming through which meant it wasn’t completely sealed. I was told the foam continues to expand and they were going to lunch. Came back and I pointed out same spots. They did fix it. Back on track. Metal around windows was terrible. Text their boss and showed pictures, walked outside to talk to them, just caulked it and send it. Ok, leave and I’ll complain.
Next installers come to fix metal. I would say metal looked better but not totally fixed like I was promised. Now I have a caulking mess on my hands!! I do mean mess. I wish you could post pictures. Will see how they respond. So far nothing from my contact.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving your feedback and apologize for issues with your project. I have passed the information onto the location and they should be reaching out shortly to get this addressed. Champion Customer Care

name: Bridget Jones
text: Gary Douglas was very professional and great with everything he showed me and my husband. Looking forward to doing business.

resp.text: Bridget, We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a positive review.   We are dedicated to providing great service.  Please feel free to reach out if there’s anything you need.

name: Melanie Reynolds
text: Robin was incredible. Very knowledgeable and professional. Had a great experience.

name: Gary Shults
text:

The windows have had a great impact on our utility bills and the comfort of our home.
My wife loves the beauty and ease of use of the Champion windows.

text: Windows looks good had for couples year and trim starting to come lose . Have called several times get answer machine . They answer one time and was told the service department will get back with me. That's been a couple weeks no one called.  It bad to pay all that money and get no service respond .

resp.text: Champion does apologize for the lack of communication, due to COVID 19 our service department is backed up but is working hard to respond to all request. Please reach  out to 888-395-0041. Champion Customer Care

name: Julian Meloni
text: Unbelievable company with the highest quality products around and at a great price. The price you pay for this quality is the greatest and it kills any of the other competitors products I’ve seen.  Best life time warranty there is, and the sales rep and installers are the best in the business. This company has been around for 66 years and I see why. I recommend this company to anyone doing home exterior projects

resp.text: Thank you Julian for sharing your positive experience with Champion.  We will share your review with the local office.

text: I have been working with Doug Shults and Doug Douglas and am very disappointed with their work. I have used Champion in the past and wanted to use them again with a new project. However, they do not meet deadlines and don't follow-up on problems. Will not use them in the future

resp.text: Thank you very much for your recommendation and continued patronage! We're so glad to hear that our customer service and products continue to meet your expectations. We appreciate this review!

name: Sara
text: Top notch service and products! Recently had 20 new windows installed in our home by this company! The process was smooth and easy starting with Gary, the sales rep followed by Jerod, the install manager. Both were very professional. Tim and Shayne installed the windows in a timely manner.  They were very friendly, organized, and left zero mess. You can tell they took pride in their work. We can already tell a big difference in temperature inside our home these last few very cold days. Just being able to open the windows is such a treat as well! We highly recommend this company.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to leave this great review. Enjoy your windows! -Champion Customer Care

name: Ronnie Laymon
text:
My wife and I replaced all of our windows in our Montgomery Alabama home.
Install Supervisor Jarod McNeal and 2 other guys named Jacob Hubbard and Michael Little were punctual, very knowledgeable and above all honest.
Champion Windows are extremely lucky to have these guys working for them.You will not be disappointed if any of these guys are on your install team.

name: Kayla Absher
text: We ordered our Champion Windows and they were installed 6 weeks later which was less time than we expected.  Bo was our salesman and he was exceptional at communicating and answering any and all of our questions.  The installers (Tim and Shane) who came to our house worked with our schedule so that we did not have to take any additional PTO.  At our home they were courteous, professional, and fun to have around.  Since our installation, we have not had to touch our AC or Heat as our home has remained comfortable.  We LOVE our windows and new back door!

resp.text: Thank you for taking your time to share your positive experience Champion.  We will be sure to pass your comments on to the local branch.

text: Thrilled with the windows we just had installed from Champion of Birmingham. The installers were nice and respectful and did a great job cleaning up. I feel great that they have a lifetime warranty if anything were to happen to them!

text: I placed an order with Champion Windows and they were installed 5 weeks later.  Bo Smith was my salesman and he was awesome in explaining all the window options, benefits, warranty and answered all other related questions.   The installers were on time, professional  and courteous.   The job took approximately 4 hours and they cleaned up and removed all exces supplies on their way out the door.  Since the installation, my electric bill has reduced by 50% and the temperature in my condo remains constant with adjusting the thermostat.   Also, my windows look great and has added to the condo's appeal.  Thank you Champion Windows for this outstanding service.

resp.text: Thank you for taking your time to share your positive experience with Champion.  We will be sure to pass your comments on to the local branch.

name: Kelsey Parrish
text:
Update: guys came out to address last set of issues. Corey in service is so polite and professional; he truly cares about fixing any issues. Ultimately the project looks great. I wish we had handled things a little earlier in the process but you live and you learn. I can recommend Champion but as with any company, double check their work and have them address it right away.

Original edit: Service managers came out and reviewed issues with us after making a recent complaint (gave 1 star a few weeks ago). Champion has nice products but make sure you point out mistakes before the crews leave!  We feel bad for having them come out so many times to fix a few major (crooked siding on two windows, etc) and many minor (bad caulking in spots, corners not lining up nicely, etc) problems but we want to be able to be happy that Champion did our siding and windows.
After the last set of work is done I may change to higher rate.

Original post has been deleted due to all the work that’s been put in recently to make sure the job was done right!

text: Joe was very professional.

name: W. Shipman
text:
We had one of the factory representatives to come by our house to give an estimate on a sunroom. Almost immediately, he began to bad mouth the competitors - very unprofessional.  His job was to convince us why we should do business with Champion ... period. That was the FIRST MISTAKE.
We were not 100% on board with the decision to work with Champion and was told we could give our final decision by Monday (the visit was Wednesday evening). Now... with that being said, nothing was 'official'. However, the Rep took it upon himself to pull my husband's credit report WITHOUT permission. He never indicated he was requesting this information otherwise it would have been a immediate NO!  Fortunately, I caught him before he was able to pull the other two credit bureaus. He informed us that these pulls were soft pulls when in fact, they were hard pulls against his credit report. I was livid!!  This was the SECOND MISTAKE.
Lastly, I sent a CC email to AHOLSOMBACK regarding my cancellation and requested a call back to talk about the visit. I never received a call. I cannot speak on the quality of the work. However, I can speak on the service. That alone is reason to not recommend this company.

resp.text: We are very sorry for your experience with Champion.  We have sent the information over to the District Manager to have teaching experience with the Sales Department.  Thank you for reaching out and feel free to call us at 888-395-001  National Customer Care.

name: Emma Sartin
text:
Absolutely the worst experience and customer relations I have ever seen with a company. After paying and getting the measurements, it took 2 months for the windows to be installed. During this time there was 0 communication. We tried calling and left several messages with the receptionist, but no one ever returned our call. Finally, we called our sales rep and complained. Suddenly, the windows were ready to be installed.
The day of the installation, the company sent two workers who told me they would be finished by 1. The workers showed up an hour after we were told they would. After our old windows were removed, I overheard them talking about how our windows weren’t measured correctly. When I asked what was wrong, they assured me everything was fine. Later, the workers and their boss were screaming at each other over the phone about the correct way to install the windows, the result of which was another working coming to explain the correct way to install and why the windows maybe looked too small. At 4:45, I informed the workers that I had to be somewhere at 5 pm and was already going to be late. They left, and promised to return the next morning at 8 am to finish the installation. The next day my husband stayed home from his job to be there to let them in. At 9:15 they arrived and finished the installation.

The overall quality of the windows was fine, but I have never dealt with more unprofessional people in my life. We’re still waiting for our gutters to be installed (we originally measured everything the week of July 4th). Would not recommend this company to anyone.

resp.text: We’re sorry for this experience with communication and installation, Emma. We take your comments seriously and will work with our staff to improve going forward. Please let us know if we can be of any further assistance to you. Thank you. -Champion Customer Care, 888-395-0041

name: Sam Monk
text: Hell will freeze over before I do business with Champion again. The saleman showed up on time and was more than happy to secure a 50% deposit. The length of time it took for the window to ne manufactured was about what was told us up front. It's been down hill since the install, which was not completed initially. Parts that need to be reinstalled are lying around in my kitchen. My "Thursday" appointment was scheduled for a Friday. It is now 3/29. The original install was 3/14. I had a 10:30 AM appointment for today and stayed home to get it handled. It is now 11:00 and I was told when I called that "the guy who was going to handle that didn't come it today." I now wait for another installer, who is apparently 50+ miles away, to "call me." It is a shame how a company with a good product can ruin its reputation my "don't give a damn" service. CHAPTER TWO: 1:00PM: Well, a nice young man showed up not knowing what needed to be done to complete the installation. I an going from frustrated to livid. Installers (not finisher) will need to return. WIll call and make appointment. The way it has gone so far it will be another 2-3 weeks - - - if then. Chapter 3 will be added as apprpriate.

text: My husband and I were in desperate need of replacement windows for our new (to us) home. Before we replaced our windows, our rooms were stifling hot in the summer and freezing in the winter even with the A/C or heat running. Which also meant our power bills were much higher than need be. As soon as we replaced our old windows with new, efficient windows from Holcombe Doors and Windows, we could tell a HUGE difference not only in the appearance, but our rooms were no longer hot in the summer or cold in the winter! Holcombe did an outstanding job helping us decide what windows were right for our home and completing the job. Their customer service and install team were professional, friendly and helpful. We are beyond pleased with the job Holcombe did for us, and will definitely be using them again!

resp.text:
Katrina, we have a large area of North Alabama where we provide free estimates at absolutely no cost to the customer.  It includes 72 different zip code areas and most of the metropolitan areas. Unfortunately your home is in Gurley which is not included in the free estimate area.

Our typical time to get out to jobs for estimates has historically been one or two days maximum.  It’s a source of pride for us.  But during Covid many people have chosen to stay home and upgrade their homes.  Unfortunately, like all businesses that specialize in home remodeling, we have a backlog of several weeks of work.  We have been working overtime to get our lead times back to normal and are making headway in catching up.

We offer our sincere apology for any inconvenience this has caused.  We feel it’s more important to be honest and upfront about the current backlog than to promise quicker lead times and then fail to deliver on them.

We have had problems with our VOIP phone system all day, experiencing several dropped calls. Again, we apologize if this has caused any of our customers to feel anything less than important.

name: Casey G
text:
We had a great experience with Madison Glass Company.

We recently replaced the builder grade shower in our master bathroom with a new tile shower. After the tiling was complete, I reached out to five different companies in the area to come give me quotes on a glass shower door and surround as well as an interior window pane for an insulated double pane window that one of kids had managed to crack.

Out of all five companies that came out, I felt like Wade and Kevin from Madison glass were the only ones that tried to assess the job and recommend the best solution for us. They were the only one of the five companies that realized there was not a stud behind the tile where the door was to be installed and actually recommended a solution that ended up saving us money (though they also made sure I knew they were capable of going with the more expensive solution if we decided to go that route).

Using the information that they provided, I was able to go back and get a slightly cheaper quote from one of the other companies. Despite that, I went with Madison Glass because I felt I could trust Wade and Kevin to do the job right. I'm glad I did.

We had a small hiccup with the manufacturer on the first replacement window and shower door that came in, but Wade and Kevin set us up for the mean time and made sure to prioritize getting back out as soon as the replacement glass came in.

The shower looks great, the service was excellent, they let us know what to expect and then kept us informed throughout the process, and we ended up spending less than what we expected. I have already recommended them to a friend and will certainly use them in the future.

resp.text: We understand that it is difficult to find honest, dependable help. As a company, we want integrity to be the norm, not the exception. With custom installations, there are bound to be a few bumps in the road, but it's the way people handle those bumps that truly matter. I'm glad we were able to come through for you!

name: Mike Cee
text:
Window World of Dothan just finished up doing the rest of our windows.  We had some done earlier this year, and the rest of the windows done today.  Both times I was extremely pleased with the entire process, from sales to installation.  Great professionalism, excellent service, and all around wonderful people to work with.

We did have one issue with a pane that the seal failed on.  That's a real test of the warranty, and I was very pleased with how easy it was to get it corrected.  Small issues happen, what really counts is how they're handled.  Window World of Dothan made the process of get it replaced so easy-one quick email and it was done.

Kudos to the entire team at Window World of Dothan.  You folks are great, and I have no problem recommending you.

resp.text: Thanks Mike. Appreciate your business and taking the time to do this review. Apologies for any inconvenience, but happy that you are satisfied with the final product.

name: C. Gatlin
text:
If I could give Window World of Dothan, AL a -100, I would.  I would NEVER refer them to anyone nor EVER use them again.  They are the absolute worst in customer service.  The salesperson is the face of the company and that’s about as good as it gets.   It is difficult to contact them by phone and when you do no one is ever around who has any answers.  The receptionist or answering service must always get back to you, and usually never the same day.  I don’t know the criteria for Window World being ranked as the #1 replacement company in America, but it can’t be based on any contributions from Window World of Dothan, AL, at least not for doors and shutters.

We contracted with Window World of Dothan, AL on 1 Oct 2019 for 10 sets of outdoor shutters and a front door.  The install should have only taken a day. The install began on 16 Nov in the late afternoon and still has not been completed as of today, 9 Jan 2020.  The individual sent to install the shutters and door obviously didn’t care about the job because the quality of the installs were substandard.  We tried to give him space and let him do his job, but that was a mistake because when we looked closer at the tall shutters they were installed with only 4 pegs instead of 6 (industry standard) and did not place the pegs uniformly (symmetrically) into the mortar, some directly into the brick.  When asked if 4 pegs was a Window World standard, he said it didn't matter.  We also asked if he filled the old holes and he stated "some",  which we knew meant "none". His defense was to say there were lots of holes in our house.

The installer completed the haphazard shutter install and departed because it started to drizzle and he didn't want the caulking to get wet. He was supposed to return the next day (Friday) to install the door.  He sent a text on Friday to say he was still on a job in GA and wouldn't arrive until the afternoon. We responded that we didn't like afternoon appointments because he would be rushing the door install the same way he rushed the shutter install and make more mistakes.  He agreed to return the following day in the morning.  Meanwhile, my wife attempted to call Window World, Dothan several times to ask about the standards for shutter installation but no one ever called her back.

As he was installing the door on Saturday, we let him know the door was not square in the frame.  His ongoing response was to tell us that our house was the reason the door wasn't straight. Once the install was complete we continued to let him know we were not satisfied with the way the door looked in the frame.  As he prepared to install the storm door, he realized the frame had to be shimmed and stated he would return on Sunday to finish the job.  When he returned at 9am we told him that the thresh hold needed to be adjusted more because we could see car lights under the door and feel the cold air. He appeared a little agitated. He became more agitated when my wife asked "hypothetically" what would happen if we wanted to discuss the possibility of getting another door. He then said he could fix the door.  My wife asked him if that was the case why he hadn't fixed it in the first place.  He proceeded to tell my wife that she complained about the shutters and every little thing about the door. He then stopped what he was doing and left the storm door uninstalled.  He told her that day was his last day at Window World so he didn't care if we complained.

My wife called Window World the following Monday  and asked to speak to the owner.  Instead of being contacted by the owner, the salesman was sent for damage control.  He stated he would have the shutters reordered and expedited.  Another installer was sent to correct the door install.  He made some additional adjustments that helped but was still not the quality of install we expected.  It is currently 9 Jan 2020 and we have not heard from Window World about the shutters or the fact that we are extremely DISSATISFIED customers.  Their lack of care, concern, and communication speaks volumes about the organization.

resp.text: Mr. Gatlin, we appreciate the time spent sharing this information with us. There are several items mentioned in your comments that we are not clear on from our previous communications with you. We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss in more detail, as well as give you an update on the shutters we reordered for you. Management will reach out to you promptly to discuss. Regards.

name: Jason Horvath
text:
Salesman Kevin was very knowledgeable and convincing that Champion Windows is the best option and we would have no issues so  I cancelled my appointment with a competitor for the next day. Kevin mentioned it would take 6-8 weeks (possibly as little as 3 weeks) but there was absolutely NO communication from Champion the whole 8 weeks. On week #6 half the bill was charged with interest with NO work being completed and no communication on when it would be completed/started. When this was addressed with Charlie (owner) it was ignored and not resolved. There was no mention of us being charged BEFORE work was completed. We called the Champion local office twice with no response. On the 3rd time we called corporate and Damon (installation manager) quickly returned my call.
The installation guys were 40 minutes late from appointment time, again with NO communication. I had to call to find out they needed to stop and get caulk on the way to my house. I would think they would have been prepared with the proper equipment prior to the customer's appointment time.
The installers were polite and professional, however I brought up some quality issues during the installation process that did not get properly taken care of until they said they were leaving causing them to stay longer and redo some of their work. (Gap in the J-molding, they wanted to caulk the gap, not fix it) Corporate called me wanted me to sign a form stating the job was done even though the installers were still here finishing the job.  When I mentioned the issues regarding some other problems (window & screen defects) Damon called me to come out to resolve the issues.
Bottom Line: Customer service and apologies goes a long way. I feel that I had reach out and try to communicate to get the work done that costs thousands of dollars. As a customer, I should not have to work as hard as I did to get the job done properly which is still in progress.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Jason. We use this feedback to make sure our services are nothing less than the best for all our customers. We are sorry to hear that you had a poor experience with us. If you would like to reach out to us in national customer care to speak further, please call us at 513-327-7338. Thank you.

name: James Tynan
text:
5 Stars -They did a great job in 2017 when they installed my sunroom.
0 Stars - In the last few months (April-May 2021) I have been trying to get in touch with someone, anyone, at Champion anywhere from Huntsville Alabama to their offices in Cincinnati. I have spoken to a few people that have given me nothing but a runaround. Several promised they would work out my issue and follow it through to a satisfactory conclusion. Nothing happening so far and based on recent past experience, I'm not holding my breath.
All I am trying to do is get a pet door that fits the wall in may 3 season room. I'm willing to consider buying it out right or having them install it. Can't even get anyone to talk to me about it.

resp.text: James, We want to sincerely apologize for your negative experience with us. We want to make things right. Please call us in our national customer care office directly at (513) 327-7338 at your earliest convenience. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Cat Taps
text:
We contacted the toll-free number for Champion Windows (please know: this # is not your local Champion dealer but just a service...I hope!) for 6 months!  We just wanted a person to come by and talk to us about a new sunroom. This phone system service (meaning=the "trained" people manning the phones) is highly disorganized! Perhaps it is because of the virus? Leaving messages or even setting up appointments to meet with a representative and that representative never showed is very disheartening. (0 stars for that set-up-an-appt craziness.) Corporate office? You need to get that fixed! Perhaps employ another phone service to answer your toll calls? 🤔

FINALLY...after months of calls...we got our Champion reps at our home.

Matt and Charles came to us in East Limestone from the Huntsville office which is by the airport. Having already had sales presentations by two competitors, we knew what to expect in their presentation. They immediately realized we were most interested in quality and price for our new sunroom.

Matt was thorough in showing us the construction of their unique products. He even had samples to demonstrate the sunroom's best attributes.

We were surprised at the price. Matt was precise and clear on it. One contract, too, one price. Never additional hidden fees. Perhaps we contacted them at the correct time since it is December after all. 😁 Good price for the quality...the sunroom we chose actually can be added to our home square footage.

Charles invited us to come by their showroom. I suggest everyone do this! Seeing several sunrooms already set up truly helps in your decision process versus just seeing magazine quality sunrooms in their catalogs.

Charles even brought us to the back of where products are custom made for every sunroom. These are not kits. We went for the 6in depth walls. Seeing the sun rooms in the office and showroom also convinced us to go ahead with additional products. Charles was not pushy at all. We made these decisions on our own.

Both Matt & Charles also gave us their personal cell phone numbers and we have called them several times. They have always been available -immediately-. We appreciate this courtesy! (Those 5 ⭐'s for them.)

Having read 1-🌟 reviews from a year ago...yikes! We decided to see for ourselves and really tested our sales team. We also detected this Huntsville office was working to improve themselves. So far? We are off to a good start. We are waiting for construction people to come and measurable are sunroom. Hope to bring you up-to-date after this happens.

resp.text: Hello Cat, We really appreciate the time you took to leave such a detailed and thoughtful review! We hope we can continue to provide great service throughout your project!

name: Jeffrey Cole
text:
The other Google reviews they have are accurate! We worked with Matt Jackson to get a quote, but he kept changing pricing every time we asked him to calculate it for us. He lied to tell us about what the windows would look like, and told us the installers were all Champion employees - which they are not. Champion will contract your job out to unprofessional, inexperienced, cheap laborers. Their sub-contractors repeatedly left our house completely open to the elements for hours and even days at a time which led to many issues for which Champion refused to accept responsibility. We spoke to Corey, the install manager, Rob McCauley, the regional manager, and even a national customer service manager - all who insisted the issues we experienced were not Champion's fault. Corey's temper when we involved Rob in communicating our concerns was completely unprofessional. Rob offered to give us a gift card for dinner as a compensation for the trouble we experienced (what a joke!). The national customer service manager threatened me and swore at me when I insisted Champion make the right the issues we experienced.

This company is full of dishonest, unprofessional, and unexperienced people charging high prices for a product of average quality.

UPDATE IN RESPONSE TO CHAMPION'S RESPONSE: If nothing else, please take Champion's sarcastic response to my feedback as a token of their lack of professionalism. You can see from the reviews of others that our experience is not an outlier, but rather the norm for how Champion operates. Of course we noted our windows had just been replaced - WE SPENT OVER $12,000.00 ON THEM.

CHAMPION WILL LIE TO YOU, SEND SUB-PAR CONTRACTORS TO INSTALL THEIR AVERAGE-QUALITY WINDOWS, AND THEN STEAL YOUR MONEY AND DO EVERYTHING THEY CAN TO MAINTAIN THEIR FACADE TO TRAP OTHERS - DO NOT FALL FOR IT!

name: Steve Palmer
text: Excellent Product, Install and Service! This is a good long read. We have a home that has 32 windows. These windows were from the original build back in 1999. Over time these windows failed, broke internal components, were loose, didn't stay up and let so much air in between them; it really hurt our HVAC bills. We decided to look at new windows. We went through the hoops and ringers with various window companies in the area and the big box stores. The price ranges were all over the place and the functions, options, features and price points were the driving factors in this big home reno purchase. We called Champion (CW going forward) and had our salesman Whit come out and give his sales pitch. He did a great pitch and was at our house for 4 plus hours. Going over every detail and question we had. He was not afraid to say "I don't know, but I will find out" and called ahead to ask with us on his speakerphone right in front of him. He never stepped out to his truck to ask; he just did it right in front of us. We wanted an answer and he went and got one. Good bad or indifferent there was no empty promises or sugar coated answers. We were explained all the finance options and the promo they were having during our consultation. We beat him up pretty good with our wants and needs for the windows. After that was done, Cory then came out a few days later and walked me through the measurement process; again answering my rhetorical questions and others I missed with Whit. He took meticulous measurements of ALL my windows and explained what my casements would be and how they would sit in the frame. I walked through the house with and he asked questions to me about each room as he measured and took detailed notes. We discussed the order that was first taken to verify everything was right...the first time. He explained the install and what was done with that process from top to bottom. As well as what to expect with financing options again. Making this as streamlined as possible. He explained our order, what timeline for delivery was and the timeline of the install process once the windows arrived from the factory. Once our windows arrived in Huntsville, we were given a few choices on the install. We picked the date that worked on our schedule and a timeframe that made sense for the install. Once again, were explained the who what when were and how on the install team. The install team was on time the first day with everything ready and planned out so they could hit the ground running. Jimmy Mashburn and Brandon Clark were the install team and they were incredible. I have OCD about fit and finish and so does this install team. Jimmy talked with my wife so she would get the understanding of the install and what she could expect. He didn't make her feel silly for asking and was very professional with each question. We, of course stayed out of the way, but if either side had a question about a window, my wife and or Jimmy/Brandon made sure both parties were on the same page. They took their time and set everything right the first time. We didn't care how long it took and they were very meticulous and detail driven on each window. They were not in any hurry to just set 'em and forget 'em. It was done right the first time. I'm no installer but I'm a homeowner that bought 32 windows so I was wanting to find something wrong or find a shortcut that I saw...NOPE! I couldn't find anything that I felt was incorrect or not done in a make sense manner. Everything was top notch work. All my old windows were removed and stacked out of the way. Drop cloths were placed inside on each opening to make sure the removal was as clean and clutter free. All of the windows were set correctly, openings were cleaned from past dirt and debris. Professional 100%!! I felt that my money was going to the right company for our home. These are big decisions to make when getting new windows and the value of the CW product met our families need. We are truly very happy with our windows and would recommend CW to anyone!! We are very happy we went with Champion!

name: Claire Clune
text:
We were given a 5 week timeline for installation. After taking a half down payment ($3100) we haven’t heard back. After 7 weeks, my husband called a few times before they bothered to answer, saying they have no way of knowing when the windows will be done. It’s been 9.5 weeks now and no one will answer my calls or return them. I certainly understand delays are sometimes out of our control, but it is absolutely unacceptable that they are not staying in communication with us. A simple call with ‘so sorry, still in production!’ would go a long way here! I will absolutely not be recommending this company to anyone else. I welcome window depot to try to reply to this post; might be the only way I can get in communication with them. I will update if we ever hear back or get our windows installed.

UPDATE: Finally did receive a call back (After leaving messages last Wednesday and then again today) and they seemed more than a little peeved I expressed that I was unhappy with their lack of communication. Regardless of COVID as an excuse for slow production, communication of the delay should have been a given.

name: Joseph Carton
text: Ordered windows on 7/30/16, install date was 10/11/16. Windows came in with internal grids that were not even, screens missing or damaged, one window measured wrong, installers damaged tube in master bath, windows in living room came with no grid. As of 1/12/17, still waiting them to finished installation. Very hard to give a good rating based on this service they provided.

name: Dominique Ponder
text:
Wouldn't recommend anyone to use this company. We paid a deposit on our windows on June 1st, we were told it would be 8 to 10 weeks before they were installed. Called after 10 weeks  told the production company had delays. I had to call multiple times to find out this information. Never once did they call to inform me about any delay. So I waited another 4 weeks and called back. Got the same run around. Called back 2 to 3 weeks later and told them that they had a couple of days to figure something out or we would seek legal action. Miraculously a few days later they called with a confirmed ship date. The windows finally shipped and we had an appointment for install the next week. So TOTAL time from paying deposit to install was 19 weeks and 5 days.

After they installed the windows and my wife paid them, I get home from work to see trash in the driveway and the yard. I call Zach the owner and told him about the issue. Luckily they hadn't left town yet and were able to come back and clean up their mess.

name: Jason Hunter
text: I'm extremely glad that I chose Window Depot to replace my windows. The customer service from Bill  the salesman a retiree was an honest straight shooter. He did not try to sale you anything that you did not need. Zach the installer took really good measurements. He also explained in details how the windows would be installed and he answered all questions. Saving the best for last is Josh and Mike. The are the actually installers. Words cannot express about there workmanship. This is the best two man crew I have seen. They showed up on time ready to work. They did not take any lunch breaks except water breaks. They also explained the how's and why's of how they had to install the windows. On top of that Josh also fix my Doors from some previous installers. They are extremely detailed and the work can speak for itself. On a scale of 0-10 I would give them a 10 and recommend them. I will be calling them for future work if they can do it.

text: We are very pleased with the windows we had installed by Window Depot. We were given lots of information and helpful advice on finding the perfect windows for our project. The installation crew was incredibly courteous and went above and beyond with getting a date set for our windows to go up .If you're rearching companies in the area for your next home project, no need to look further. Go with this company.

name: Pavlos Honderich
text:
I had 4 bids to install 16 total existing windows original to a 3 year old house.

We wanted to install 3 slider windows where we currently had a total of 4 single hung and 3 picture frames (2 sets of 2 and a set of 3 respectively).  The remainder of the single hungs would be replaced by double hungs and the 3 remaining picture frames would be replaced with picture frame windows.

Only Bill from Window Depot would listen to us and provided honest feedback some of which may have actually resulted them taking a few hundred dollars the less from us.  They also gave us an honest price since we went with our own financing.

It was the complete opposite than what we experienced with Champion who insisted on bells and whistles we didn't need or want and cost $2000 more for the same style and quality windows.  Champions sales pitch was also high stress (must sign today shtick to get special demo offer).

Window World had come recommended from a few friends but they insisted we go with double hung in all but the one picture frame over our bay window.  They insisted it would cost too much and wasn't worth it vs their recommendation for 15 double hung and 1 bay window.  Customer always knows best and Window World lost the job from the get go for that mistake.

The quality of the Window Depot installation job is also visibly much better compared to friends who have had Window World windows installed.

Bill in sales and Zach were great to work with.  Josh and his crew did an amazing job installing the windows.

Not only did I learn that that particular siding was no longer produced by the manufacturer, I was offered advise and the name of a salesman to call Monday morning to see if they couldn't find something that would work for me. name: Allen catdaddy V
text:
Absolutely terrible customer service. I called 11/20/19 to get a lumber package delivered to save some time. I knew it would be a bit more expensive but more convenient. Delivery was quick and early 11/21/19 unfortunately delivery is at wrong address 100 yards from where it should be and about 15 boards were incorrect. Still no biggie just let them know and I would think it would be taken care of. First call was 8:40 am. Left a message for Dino with another salesman and on his cell phone. Second call was about 12:30 pm, third call was at 3:00 I was told he was still with a customer. I asked the person on the phone to please tell him so that I could hear him answer I needed a call back today, and he did. 3:30 pm Dino calls I explain 15 boards were to be pressure treated and the delivery was in the wrong spot (address) I was then argued with that I didn’t order pressure treated I wrote down the prices quoted and if it wasn’t p.t it was expensive white wood. He put me on hold when he came back to the phone he said the contractor that came in and paid told him the location. I explained it was all done over the phone and there was only me. Where he described is exactly where I told him to put it. Unfortunately that’s not where it was put. He said he would call me back and get it straightened out. No call back, so 11/22/19 I called and left a message with a nice young lady for the sales manager.(I was told his name is Jason).No call back!! I go to see if the package has been moved that afternoon. I have pressure treated wood but package not moved. So much for convenience. Now I will have to pay someone to move the wood. Oh yeah still no call back or invoice. Never again!!

Update, still no call. 11/27/19

resp.text: The pictures of the delivery show the load to be at the end of the gravel driveway by the barn and the exact material delivered that was paid for on the ticket.  I'll find out more info on Monday and be in touch.

text: Called for service when locked out of van. Brian was awesome, 5 minutes and he was done. Dispatch and her customer service was horrible.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. It made us aware of an issue that had to be addressed.  No customer should experience what you did. We would be happy to discuss this experience with you if you call 251.967.1919. Usually when people call us wanting an immediate response, they are already having a tough day. We work hard to help that day be better because they called us, not worse! Please accept our sincerest apologies for the way you were treated.

name: Joey Conwill
text: Aaron's was called out to our condo by someone that said they were staying there, had them sign a form then destroyed the lock to let them . It was a combination lock and there was a hidden key that would have overridden the lock if someone had bothered to contact the owner, or called the emergency number posted at the condo office, where a manager lives on the grounds. Aaron's said that was standard procedure, as long as the person signed the form, they could let them in. That's nice for all condo owners to know! Total cost to replace lock, almost $400. Aaron's took no responsibility. Not much integrity at this business.

resp.text: Integrity matters as well as ethical business practices.  We value and employ both in our business.  Emergency response locksmith technicians are there to help in challenging circumstances.  We do everything we can to gain entry before we considering drilling the lock.  This is a last resort.  We are sorry your lock was damaged but your renter misrepresented themselves as having authority to do so and chose to assume liability for such activity, just as they choose to assume liability for their treatment of the rest of your property when they rent from you.  With thousands of condos and hundreds of condo offices that are often closed or unmanned, we cannot track down every owner.  This is why we work hard to go above and beyond the minimum of what the law requires.  We love our customers, we love what we do and we work hard to do it well with integrity.

text: terrible service. was told it would be a 30 minute wait.  called back 40 mins later and they were supposedly on the way. called again 1 hour and 10 minutes after the first call and was told no one was coming out because i sounded drunk over the phone. i am 16 and definitely WAS NOT drunk. so, needless to say my car was not unlocked by them. TERRIBLE SERVICE WOULDNT RECOMEND TO ANYONE. only rating 1 star because that’s the lowest i can go.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.  It made us aware of an issue. We addressed that issue to ensure no customer experiences what you did.  We would be happy to discuss this experience with you if you call 251.967.1919.  Usually when people call us wanting an immediate response, they are already having a tough day.  We work hard to help that day be better because they called us, not worse!  Please accept our sincerest apologies for the way you were treated.

name: Mark Curtis
text: Fast service and no damage to car. Highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you for your review and for your business.

name: TJB
text: Locked our keys in the car and since the battery was dead On Star couldn't open it remotely. They called Aaron's and about 20 minutes later their locksmith Billy came out. He couldnt have been nicer. He unlocked the car in about a minute and then helped us jumpstart the car. Total pro and a really nice guy. Would highly reccomend Aaron's to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Libby Shepard
text: We have a camper that we keep on our property in Gulf Shores. Somehow our dogs (2 Cane Corso) lock us out, the key was inside the camper. After calling around to a few places, that said they would be several hours, an RV repair shop said to call Aaron’s. They said they could be there within the hour. Less than 20mins later Billy showed up and within 5 mins had us in the camper! He’s my hero! Thanks so much for everything!!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Keith Sharp
text: Very good customer service, was a little slow in getting to job but could have been factors that were uncontrollable. My keyless locks's battery had died -guest could not get in, they dixed everything and only charged $100 on Memorial day weekend.  Would use again

text: Received prompt professional service. The locksmith was able to remove a jammed lock from a house door. It wasn’t easy but the technician stuck with it even when I was ready to have him cut the lock out of the door.  Thankfully will now only have to replace the lock and not the whole door.
